original: sbyor ba 'dis zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: dam pa'o // yang na skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi yon tan yin pas so //

analyzed: yongs bzung zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gis yongs su bzung bas na'o //

analyzed: yon tan dam pa yang yin la yongs su bzung ba yang yin pas yon tan dam pas yongs bzung ngo ;

analyzed: / de dag gi bkra shis yin pas yon tan dam pas yongs bzung bkra shis so //

analyzed: yang na yongs su bzung ba yin pas na yongs su bzung ba ste /

analyzed: yon tan dam pa rnams kyis yongs su bzung bas na /

analyzed: yon tan dam pas yongs bzung ngo // yon tan dam phas yongs su gzung ba'i bkra shis pa ni /
translated: It is the possession of the highest virtues, because it is held by those of the highest virtues.üîΩIt is the possession of the highest virtues.üîΩThe auspiciousness of the possession of the highest virtues is

original: yon tan dam pas yongs bzung bkra shis pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan dam pas yongs bzung bkra shis pa'o //

original: bkra shis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bkra shis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Auspicious means

translated: If that is so, then the conduct of others who are not bodhisattvas, such as Indra, Vishnu, Shiva, and Rudra, is also the basis of fame.üîΩIt is said,

analyzed: smras pa / ma smad bzhin du shin tu yid du 'ong //üîΩzhes smos so //

analyzed: grags pa ni snyan pa ste rnam grangs so //

analyzed: ma smad ces bya ba ni smad pa ma yin pas na ma smad pa ste /

analyzed: des rang gi rgyud brgyan @136b cing 'jig rten las 'das par gyur pas so //

analyzed: 'dis ni spyod pa de'i ye shes kyi tshogs gzhan la phan par ston pa yin no //

original: 'jig rten pa rnams la yang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams la yang /

analyzed: 'dis sangs rgyas pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas su 'jog par byed pas tshogs so //

analyzed: yid 'phrog par byed pas yid du 'ong ba'o //

original: thub pa zhes bya ba ni gsum thub bas na thub pa ste /
analyzed: thub pa zhes bya ba ni gsum thub bas na thub pa ste /

analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa skye ba 'gog pas na thub ba'o ;

analyzed: / de'i spyod pa ni spyod pa ste tshul lo //

analyzed: de'i spyod pa rmad du byung ba yin pas rmad du byung ba ste spyod pa ngo mtshar ba'o // yang na de'i spyod pa 'das par gyur pas ni mthong ba ste /
translated: His conduct is marvelous, so it is marvelous, that is, amazing conduct.üîΩOr else, his conduct is marvelous because it is beyond the scope of the disciples and solitary realizers.

analyzed: brgya la zhig na nye bar dmigs pa yin pas rmad du byung ba rnams so //

analyzed: gus pas zhes bya ba ni dga' zhing zhes pas zhes bya'o //

analyzed: rang gi snyan ngag yin pas bdag gi snyan ngag go //

original: bdag gi snyan ngag nyid me tog yin pas bdag gi snyan ngag me tog go //
analyzed: bdag gi snyan ngag nyid me tog yin pas bdag gi snyan ngag me tog go //

analyzed: yang na me tog gi snyim pa yin pas me tog snyim pa'o //

analyzed: rang gi snyan ngag nyid me tog snyim pa yin pas na bdag gi snyan ngag me tog snyim pa'o //
translated: Since it is his poetry that is the handful of flowers, it is the handful of flowers of my poetry.

analyzed: des na bdag gi snyan ngag gi me tog snyim pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni mchod pa'i yo byad cung zad tsam du bstan te /

original: me tog gi gnas dag la snyan ngag nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: me tog gi gnas dag la snyan ngag nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: He shows that poetry is an offering of flowers.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni sbyor ba @137a * //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni sbyor ba @137a * //
translated: Thus, by this he shows that it is a religious offering.üîΩ

original: phun sum tshogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the perfection of the author.

original: grags pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa 'di rnams kyis zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten don 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni snyan ngag brtsams pa'i dgos pa bstan pa yin te /

analyzed: dgos pa dang dgos pa byed pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning is included in the two, purpose and purposeful activity.

original: tshigs bcad 'di gnyis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don mtha' dag 'di las 'byung bar bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs bcad 'di gnyis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don mtha' dag 'di las 'byung bar bstan to //
translated: These two verses show that all the aims of self and other come from this treatise.

original: de la gzhan gyi don mtha' dag las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi don mtha' dag las brtsams te /
translated: Here, beginning with the aim of others,

original: grags pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan te /
analyzed: grags pa'i mtshan mar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan te /

translated: ‚ÄúThese‚Äù refers to the previously explained merit and wisdom. ‚ÄúSigns of fame‚Äù means that by being taken up by that merit and wisdom, one becomes famous, that is, highly praised.

original: ji ltar grags pa yin zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar grags pa yin zhe na smras pa /

original: mngon snang mtshan mar gyur pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: mngon snang mtshan mar gyur pa zhes smos te /
translated: The phrase manifesting as signs means

analyzed: mtshan mar gyur pa yin bas mngon snang mtshan mar gyur pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, manifesting as signs means that it is both manifesting and becoming a sign.

analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi'o //

analyzed: dang 'brel pa'i phyir bdag gis byas pa ma yin par ston to //

original: mtho ris 'dod dang rgyal srid bsgrub phyir min //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: de lta ni ma yin gyi bdag nyid sbyin pa nyes par 'gyur zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: gang zhig slong ba de ni sbyin par bya //

analyzed: gzhan yang de rnams kyi sbyin pa'i bgegs kyi nyes par bsgrubs pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gang zhig slong ba de ni sbyin par bya zhes bya ba 'dis te /

analyzed: gang @152b las she na /

original: slong ba de nyid thob cing slongs nas ni dga' bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: slong ba de nyid thob cing slongs nas ni dga' bar gyur pa yin te /

analyzed: de ltar rang gi mig sbyin pa rigs par bstan nas nor dang 'bru la sogs pa gzhan ni de la byin yang sbyin pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni byin yang dgar mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i sbyin pas dga' bar mi 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir bshad de /

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /

original: dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpes bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: smras pa / sbyin pa las byung yon tan dga' la sogs pa zhes smos te /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúThe virtues arising from giving are joy and so on.‚Äù

original: ji ltar dga' ba la sogs pa'i yon tan yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dga' ba la sogs pa'i yon tan yin zhe na /
translated: How are they virtues of joy and so on?

original: lhag par rjes su 'brang ba'i yid tshim pa'i dga' ba skyes pas lus sbyangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag par rjes su 'brang ba'i yid tshim pa'i dga' ba skyes pas lus sbyangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Joy is the satisfaction of the mind that follows after it.

original: lus sbyangs pa las ni bde ba so sor myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus sbyangs pa las ni bde ba so sor myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the purification of the body, one experiences bliss.

original: sems bde bas ni ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems bde bas ni ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the bliss of mind, one attains meditative concentration.

original: sems mnyam par @162b gzhag pa las ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems mnyam par @162b gzhag pa las ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur te /
translated: From the mind in meditative concentration, one attains knowledge of things as they really are.

original: de ltar dga' ba la sogs pa'i yon tan sbyin pa las byung ba'i grags pa dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dga' ba la sogs pa'i yon tan sbyin pa las byung ba'i grags pa dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one becomes endowed with the virtues of joy and so on, arising from giving, and also with fame.

original: da ni sbyin pa'i chos dang / don dang / 'dod pa'i 'khor gsum gyi rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'di brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni sbyin pa'i chos dang / don dang / 'dod pa'i 'khor gsum gyi rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'di brtsams pa yin te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the generosity of the Dharma as the cause of the three spheres of aim, meaning, and desire, he composes this.

original: sbyin pa zhes bya gter chen zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /üîΩgter chen zhes bya ba gter gzhan ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes bya gter chen zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te / gter chen zhes bya ba gter gzhan ni /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúGenerosity is called the great treasure,‚Äù and so on.

original: god pa dang yongs su zad pa'o //
analyzed: god pa dang yongs su zad pa'o //
translated: The great treasure is not lost or exhausted.

original: rjes su 'gro zhes bya ba ni gter gzhan ni 'jig rten pha rol du mi 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro zhes bya ba ni gter gzhan ni 'jig rten pha rol du mi 'gro ba yin te /
translated: ‚Äú It follows‚Äù means that the other treasure does not follow into the next world,

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pha rol tu rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pha rol tu rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: but this one does.

original: gter gzhan ni rkun po la sogs pa dang thun mong yin gyi /
analyzed: gter gzhan ni rkun po la sogs pa dang thun mong yin gyi /
translated: The other treasure is shared with thieves and so on,

original: 'di ni thun mong ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni thun mong ma yin te /
translated: but this one is not shared.

original: sbyin pa'i bdag nyid khyad par 'phags pa'i don gyi rgyur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bdag nyid khyad par 'phags pa'i don gyi rgyur gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the special meaning of the generosity of the self.

original: ji ltar chos kyi rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos kyi rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it become the cause of the Dharma?

original: chos kyi rgyu de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyu de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that cause of the Dharma, he says,

original: sbyin pa 'dod dang ser sna zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sbyin pa 'dod dang ser sna zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúGenerosity is the cause of desire and non-desire.‚Äù

original: sbyin pa dang 'gal ba'i sems kyis kun tu 'dzin pa ni ser sna'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang 'gal ba'i sems kyis kun tu 'dzin pa ni ser sna'o //
translated: Stinginess is the grasping of the mind that is contrary to giving.

original: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is the intolerance of the excellence of others.

original: skyon ni de las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: skyon ni de las gzhan pa ste /
translated: Fault is something other than that.

original: sred pa dang / zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: sred pa dang / zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa'o//
translated: Craving, hatred, pride, ignorance, etc. are faults.

original: de nyid rdul yin pas de'i rdul te /
analyzed: de nyid rdul yin pas de'i rdul te /
translated: It is a dust because it is a dust of that, i.e., of the faults.

original: rdul ni sgrib pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdul ni sgrib pa'i don to //
translated: Dust has the meaning of obscuration.

original: de bas na skyon de rnams sbyong bar byed pas chos kyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na skyon de rnams sbyong bar byed pas chos kyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a cause of Dharma because it purifies those faults.

original: sbyin pa 'khor ba'i zhes pa 'di'i don gyis ni 'dod pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa 'khor ba'i zhes pa 'di'i don gyis ni 'dod pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin te /
translated: Giving is the cause of samsara. By the meaning of this, it is the cause of desire.

original: 'khor ba nyid lam yin pas na 'khor ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba nyid lam yin pas na 'khor ba'i lam ste /
translated: Since samsara itself is the path, it is the path of samsara.

original: bgrod par bya ba yin pas 'khor ba'i lam zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba yin pas 'khor ba'i lam zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the path of samsara because it is to be traversed.

original: 'khor ba'i lam du bgrod pas ngal ba ni 'khor ba'i lam bgrod pas ngal ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i lam du bgrod pas ngal ba ni 'khor ba'i lam bgrod pas ngal ba ste /
translated: Exhaustion by traversing the path of samsara is exhaustion by traversing the path of samsara.

original: bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis ngal ba'o //
analyzed: bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis ngal ba'o //
translated: It is exhaustion by the suffering of hunger, thirst, etc.

original: sel ba yin pas med pa ste /
analyzed: sel ba yin pas med pa ste /
translated: Since it is the removal of suffering, it is the absence of suffering.

original: de la med pa ni 'khor ba'i lam bgrod ngal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de la med pa ni 'khor ba'i lam bgrod ngal ba med pa'o //
translated: In this context, the absence of suffering is the absence of the weariness of traveling the path of cyclic existence.

original: 'dis ni sdug bsngal las ldog par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sdug bsngal las ldog par bstan to //
translated: This shows the turning away from suffering.

original: sdug bsngal bsal nas bde ba bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsal nas bde ba bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the establishment of happiness after the removal of suffering,

original: sbyin pa bde ba mang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rkang yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa bde ba mang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rkang yin te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúGenerosity is the abundant source of happiness.

original: gcig ma yin pa'i bde ba yin te /
analyzed: gcig ma yin pa'i bde ba yin te /
translated: ‚Äù It is not a single happiness,

original: bde ba mang po'o //
analyzed: bde ba mang po'o //
translated: it is abundant happiness.

original: @163a * // de dag sgrub pa ni bde ba mang po 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: @163a * // de dag sgrub pa ni bde ba mang po 'grub pa'o //
translated: The establishment of that is the abundant source of happiness.üîΩIt is a good friend,

original: grogs po bzang po zhes bya ba ni grogs po yang yin la bzang po yang yin pas grogs po bzang po'o //
analyzed: grogs po bzang po zhes bya ba ni grogs po yang yin la bzang po yang yin pas grogs po bzang po'o //
translated: because it is a friend and it is good, it is a good friend.

original: ji ltar grogs po bzang po yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar grogs po bzang po yin zhe na /
translated: How is it a good friend?

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis te /
translated: In the manner previously explained,

original: bde ba mang po sgrub par byed pas so //
analyzed: bde ba mang po sgrub par byed pas so //
translated: because it establishes abundant happiness.üîΩIt is supreme,

original: mchog yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag tu nye bar 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag tu nye bar 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always present.

original: de ltar sbyin pas chos dang / don dang / 'dod pa rnams 'grub par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pas chos dang / don dang / 'dod pa rnams 'grub par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that generosity accomplishes the Dharma, its meaning, and one's wishes,

original: sbyin pa ni dang po yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni dang po yin te /
translated: it is said that generosity is the first,

original: des na des yongs su bzung ba ste /
analyzed: des na des yongs su bzung ba ste /
translated: because it is the one that is taken up by all the bodhisattvas.

original: de'i dbang du byas pa yin pas gzhan las gtsor byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas pa yin pas gzhan las gtsor byas pa yin no //
translated: Since it is taken up by them, it is foremost in comparison to the others.

original: sbyin pa nyid kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu mtha' dag thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa nyid kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu mtha' dag thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don yin te /
translated: The meaning of the statement is that one obtains the entire result of the accumulation of merit through generosity itself.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The accumulation of merit is threefold:

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa ste rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa ste rnam pa gsum mo //

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs rnam pa gsum las 'bras bu yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs rnam pa gsum las 'bras bu yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: From the three types of accumulation of merit, there are three types of results.

original: sbyin pas ni longs spyod chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pas ni longs spyod chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Through generosity, one obtains great wealth.

original: bzod pas ni 'khor mang ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pas ni 'khor mang ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Through patience, one obtains a retinue.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni bde 'gror skye ba ste bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni bde 'gror skye ba ste bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa'o //

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bus ni 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bus ni 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //

original: bzod pas ni bka' lung phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pas ni bka' lung phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The result of patience is the perfection of advice.

original: de yang sbyin pa nyid kyis 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: de yang sbyin pa nyid kyis 'grub pa ste /

original: sngon sbyin pa'i dus su slong mo ba rnams kyi ngag bzhin du byas te /
analyzed: sngon sbyin pa'i dus su slong mo ba rnams kyi ngag bzhin du byas te /
translated: In the past, at the time of generosity, one acted in accordance with the words of beggars.

original: 'dod pa'i don rab tu bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir bka' lung mnyan pa'i yon tan thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don rab tu bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir bka' lung mnyan pa'i yon tan thob pa'o //
translated: Because one fully accomplished the desired aim, one obtained the quality of heeding advice.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pho brang gnas sam zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pho brang gnas sam zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu ste /
translated: The line ‚Äúin the palace of the Thirty-Three‚Äù refers to the result of morality.

original: sbyin pa'i dus su slong mo ba rnams kyi ngag bzhin du byas te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dus su slong mo ba rnams kyi ngag bzhin du byas te /
translated: At the time of generosity, one acted in accordance with the words of beggars.

analyzed: 'dod pa'i don rab tu bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir bde ba bskyed pa yin te /

original: de bas na sum cu rtsa gsum gyi pho brang du gnas pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na sum cu rtsa gsum gyi pho brang du gnas pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid do //

original: gzugs bzang yon tan zhes bya ba yang tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs bzang yon tan zhes bya ba yang tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu nyid do //

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'dis thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'dis thob pa yin te /

original: mdog phun sum tshogs pa sbyin pa'i dngos po ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: mdog phun sum tshogs pa sbyin pa'i dngos po ma yin pa las so //
translated: A perfect complexion is not the substance of a gift.

original: gang zhig 'dod pa @163b de dag thams cad sbyin pas thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni re zhig 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsod nams kyi 'bras bu thams cad 'dis 'thob ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: sbyin pa dbang phyug rnams kyi rgyu //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i mngon par mtho ba'i rgyur byas pa'o //

analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar rgyu ba dang / chos mthun pa rnam par rtog pa'i g-yo bas bskyod pa'i yid dang ldan pa'i phongs pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa'i g-yo bas bskyod pa yin la /

analyzed: de'i bsod nams kyi tshogs rnam par 'phel bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba la /

translated: ‚Äúhe‚Äù refers to the bodhisattva.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyid bud shing yin pas nyon mongs pa'i bud shing ngo //

original: de yang mi mthun pa'i chos su bstan te /

original: des smras pa /

analyzed: mi g-yo ba brtan zhing zhi ba zhes pa dag gis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs par bstan pa yin te /
